messages.title: 10 reasons to VOTE GREEN
messages.content: A fully-funded NHS, fair 'local' economy, affordable rented homes, public-owned railways, a living wage, re-regulated buses, an alternative to austerity, free inclusive education, a referendum on Europe, and a Cornish assembly.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Putting patient care before private profits, with improved pay and working conditions.
With community-owned renewable energy and an end to VAT on tourism.
Build local sustainable housing where it's needed with longer tenancies and rent caps.
Bring the railways back into public hands and immediately cut fares by 10%.
So taxpayers don't have to top-up private sector poverty pay through in-work benefits.
Local authority to once again run buses as a public service, not a private business.
Close loop-holes and end tax evasion so we can reverse cuts to essential local services.
Promote comprehensive mixed-ability teaching with no SATs and scrap tuition fees.
With a grown-up, in-depth national debate looking at the real pros and cons of the EU.
With more power for Cornwall over spending, health and education.

mentions.tacticalSituation: In this election you can give your voice to those with the courage to reshape our country for the common good.

issues.brexitEurope: A referendum on Europe with a grown-up, in-depth national debate looking at the real pros and cons of the EU.
issues.economy: A fair 'local' economy with community-owned renewable energy and an end to VAT on tourism.
issues.education: Free inclusive education to promote comprehensive mixed-ability teaching with no SATs and scrap tuition fees.
issues.governance: A Cornish assembly with more power for Cornwall over spending, health and education.
issues.health: A fully-funded NHS putting patient care before private profits, with improved pay and working conditions.

housing.content: Affordable rented homes build local sustainable housing where it's needed with longer tenancies and rent caps.

leaflet.personalStatement: I am standing as your Green Party candidate for St Austell and Newquay because I want something better than business-as-usual politics.

images.caption: Steve Slade in front of a coastal scene.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet also contains a pie chart with the results of a survey conducted in 2010/2011 mentioning that this is how St Austell & Newquay would have looked if everyone had voted polices last time.
